meanings.definition: The act of managing or overseeing something together with others.
meanings.sent1: In our project, the comanagements of tasks helped us work efficiently as a team.
meanings.sent2: The comanagements of the company were divided among the partners to ensure smooth operations.
meanings.sent3: The comanagements of the school play made sure everything ran smoothly backstage.
meanings.sent4: Their comanagements of the event were like a well-oiled machine, each playing a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: The comanagements of the zoo made sure all the animals were well taken care of.

meanings.definition: The practice of jointly managing a business or organization.
meanings.sent1: Effective comanagements of the store led to increased profits for the owners.
meanings.sent2: The comanagements of the restaurant involved both partners making key decisions together.
meanings.sent3: The comanagements of the soccer team ensured that both coaches were always on the same page.
meanings.sent4: Their comanagements of the project were like a synchronized dance, each step perfectly coordinated.
meanings.sent5: The comanagements of the charity event brought together different skills for a successful outcome.

meanings.definition: The process of sharing management responsibilities with another party.
meanings.sent1: The comanagements of the department allowed for a more balanced workload.
meanings.sent2: In their comanagements of the project, they each took on specific tasks to share the load.
meanings.sent3: The comanagements of the team project made sure everyone had a role to play.
meanings.sent4: Their comanagements of the business partnership were like a seamless collaboration, each contributing equally.
meanings.sent5: The comanagements of the event planning ensured that no detail was overlooked.
